Title: nettle: Information disclosure
Synopsis:
A cache-related side channel vulnerability was found in nettle
    which might allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information.

Background.Text: Nettle is a cryptographic library that is designed to fit easily in almost any context: In cryptographic toolkits for object-oriented languages, such as C++, Python, or Pike, in applications like lsh or GnuPG, or even in kernel space.

Description.Text:
It was found that nettle’s RSA and DSA decryption code was vulnerable to cache-related side channel attacks.

See the referenced technical paper “Cache Attacks Enable Bulk Key Recovery on the Cloud” below for details.

Impact.Text: An attacker could recover the private key from a co-located virtual-machine instance.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All nettle users should upgrade to the latest version:

URI.Text:
Cache Attacks Enable Bulk
      Key Recovery on the Cloud
